subject: Re: [junit] Problems with WL transactions and JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Admittedly, I don t prefer to use explicit transaction management, or unit test EJBs in this fashion, but... Try using the TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED
messageBody:
Laurent Duperval wrote:

> On 19 Oct, Mike Clark wrote:
> > Laurent Duperval wrote:
> >
> >> On 19 Oct, Mike Clark wrote:
> >> > Perhaps a look at the TransactionTestCase.setUp() would help, as this
> >> > seems to be the differentiator.
> >> >
> >
> > The UserTransaction is enlisting all the EJB resources, but I suspect that
> > the transaction isolation levels are causing the finder to only read
> > committed data, and the call to setDefault(true) isn't being committed.
> >
>
> That's what we suspect also. Other than removing the Transaction, do you (or
> anyone else) have a suggestion for us to correct this?

Admittedly, I don't prefer to use explicit transaction management, or unit test
EJBs in this fashion, but...

Try using the TRANSACTION_READ_UNCOMMITTED isolation level for
the finder method as declared in the weblogic-cmp-rdbms-jar.xml deployment file.
This has side effects for the production system you'll need to consider, as it
probably only makes sense for unit testing. Your mileage may vary.

Mike
